title: I'm 14, will I grow more? - Quora

response.answer_text: Chances are that you're still growing, but if you're not, it's usually due to early puberty. Early puberty causes a stature shorter than expected height, usually by around two or three inches. ... You will probably grow at least 2–3 inches. At 14 i was 5′9 ,next year 5′11 and next year 6′. Boys are an average 3.2 inches taller as 14-year-olds and another 2.1 inches taller as 15-year-olds, when they are 5 feet 8 on average. At 19 years of age, they are almost 5 feet 10, the CDC reports. The average 13-year-old girl is 62.6 inches, only 1.2 inches taller than the year before. Go to my Profile and you can find all about Grow Taller material there...

.. If you aim to loose weight now you’re unlikely to grow much more. Stop that immediately and give your body the nutrients and energy it needs to reach its full potential. Essentially eat a normal portion for someone your age and forget all about dieting until you actually reach an age where it doesn't affect you physically (and even mentally).. or alternatively you do so under the supervision of a doctor to ensure you 1. need it and 2. there’s no negative side effects. (both your body and brain is still changing and growing (well - not literary when it comes to your brain - but until you’re in your 20’s your brain is still changing +) so depriving yourself of what it needs is.. unwise). How to Understand the Risks of Eating Too Few Calories Dieting in adolescence
